qas.question: What is one of the largest Protestant branches with 80 million members?
How popular is the branch of Lutheranism?
What is the largest body of Lutheran churches?
How many people belong to the Lutheran World Federation?
Name two smaller Lutheran church bodies.

answers.text: International Lutheran Council and the Confessional Evangelical Lutheran Conference

context: Today, <a0_0>Lutheranism<a0_0/> is one of the largest branches of Protestantism. With approximately 80 million adherents, it constitutes the <a1_0>third<a1_0/> most common Protestant confession after historically Pentecostal denominations and Anglicanism. <a2_0>The Lutheran World Federation<a2_0/>, the largest global communion of Lutheran churches represents <a3_0>over 72 million people<a3_0/>. Additionally, there are also many smaller bodies such as the <a4_0>International Lutheran Council and the Confessional Evangelical Lutheran Conference<a4_0/>, as well as independent churches.
